div.span: School will be closed from Monday, March 16 through Friday, May 15 as per Executive Order from Governor Cuomo. School is currently scheduled to begin again on Monday, May 18.

55 Main St. P.O. Box 301
Laurens, NY 13796

li.a: Corrective Action to Management letter for 2017-2018
Corrective Action to Management letter for 2017-2018

img.style: border-width:0px;width: 41px; vertical-align: middle; padding: 10px; border-left: 1px solid rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.12); border-right: 1px solid rgba(255, 255, 255, 0.12);

br.span: * Time Frame for work to be completed: April 27 – May 8
* Bus pickup date will be Friday, May 8, 2020, 1:00pm – 2:00pm
* Students are to be waiting at their bus stop during this time frame.
(6 hrs later than normal bus time)
* Students will place packet #3 in the tote on the bus and will be handed
* Walkers can return the packet to the school on Friday,
* Valley Stream Trailer park pickup will be on Friday,
* Any student with a USB Jump Drive (A) is to return the drive with their
packet and a replacement (B) will be provided.

Come out on Friday, April 24th and wave to your teachers and school support staff as we participate in an “LCS – We Miss You” parade. The “car parade” will leave the school at 2:00pm, and travel down Route 11 toward West Oneonta. The parade will then turn right onto Route 23, driving toward West Laurens. In West Laurens, the parade will turn onto Route 10, heading back to Laurens. Once in Laurens we will then head north on Route 11, turning right on Angel Road and then right again on Route 205, driving straight through Mt. Vision, and back down 205 to Laurens and the school.
We hope you come outside and wave to your teachers/ members of the Support staff for this fun event! Take some photos and share with your family and friends! We hope to see you all!

br.strong: IMPORTANT INFORMATION FOR PARENTS AND STUDENTS

span.strong: Please read all of the following as it contains several important pieces of information:

br.br:
As you are most likely aware, the Governor has closed all schools through May 15th. That means the first possible day back to school could be May 18th, but only if there are no additional closures.
Regents Exams
The NYS Board of Regents has canceled all Regents exams. Students who meet any one of the following criteria will be exempted from the exams:
Students in grades 8-12 will be exempted from specific Regents examination requirements for graduation under these circumstances:
* If a student was enrolled in a course leading to a Regents exam and was passing for the year at the end of the 3rd quarter, he/she will be exempted from the Regents exam.
* If a student was enrolled in a course leading to a Regents exam and was failing for the year at the end of the 3rd quarter AND has an effort grade of “Passing” for the 4th quarter, they will be exempted from that Regents exam.
* If a student was preparing to retake a Regents exam that they had previously failed in June 2019, August 2019, or January 2020 he/she will be exempted from that Regents exam if the student had previously passed the class for which the Regents is for.
Grading procedures
4th Quarter Grades for Students in K-6
* Grading for students in K-6 is standard based and is presently reflected on student report cards. Teachers will continue to assess student work and effort using the existing standards:
Below grade level (1)
Approaching (2)
Meeting standard (3)
Exceeding Standard (4)
Teachers will use the comment section to provide additional information with regard to the work assessed during the 4th quarter touching upon each subject area and focusing on the growth the student has shown.
4th Quarter Grades for students in 7-12
* Students will be “graded” for the 4th quarter based on effort and skills learned. Teachers will designate in what skills students have shown Evidence of Learning (EL) and skills Not Yet Learned (NYL).
* Evidence of Learning: Student has demonstrated learning of essential curriculum based on what was taught and assigned.
* Not Yet Learned: Student has not completed assignment, or work completed does not yet demonstrate learning of essential curriculum. Student will be given the opportunity to redo and resubmit work to demonstrate learning.
* Effort will be based on:
- Student rate of participation
- Quality of work completed/submitted
- A minimum of weekly communication with the teacher
* Students will receive a pass/fail grade only for the quarter
Promotion & Final Averages for the Year
Grades K-6
Teachers will determine whether a student is promoted to the next grade level based on their progress through our initial date of closure (3/13/2020). Only students who were considered for retention prior to March 13th will be discussed for retention. The teacher must speak to Mrs. Wenck, Mr. Dorritie and Mrs. Gifford before meeting with the parents and before a final determination will be made.
Grades 7-12
All final grades for the 2019-2020 school year will be converted to a Pass/Fail.
* If a student had a passing yearly average as of the end of the 3rd quarter, he/she will receive a “Pass” for the year.
* If a student was not passing at the end of the 3rd quarter, the student must receive a “Pass” in the 4th quarter in order to pass the class for the year.
* If a student had a failing yearly average at the end of the 3rd quarter AND their effort grade in the 4th quarter is not passing, he/she will receive a “Fail” for that class for the year.
For more information about grading, End of Year GPAs, and promotion, please visit the school website. Under the section on COVID 19 you will find the District “Learning in a time of School Closure Continuity of Education Guidance Document.”
Guidelines for Students
• Establish daily routines for engaging in learning.
• Students are expected to complete all assignments in each packet and turn them in either in hard copy, Office 365 or email to their teachers.
• Regularly monitor email to check for announcements and feedback from teachers and staff.
• Complete assignments with integrity and academic honesty.
• Do your best to meet timelines, commitments, and due dates.
• Be proactive with your teachers when having difficulty.
• Comply with the Acceptable Use Policy including expectations for online etiquette.
Instructional Packets
The 3rd round of packets for grades K-6 have been organized and made ready for distribution. We will be distributing the packets on Friday, April 24th via our regular bus routes. The buses will leave the school with the packets at 1:00pm. This is 6 hours later than the normal student pickup time; meaning that if a students' normal pick up time is 7:00am, the bus will be at their home at 1:00pm. Students need to be outside at this new time with their first instructional packet. The packet needs to be completed and in the original envelope or a plastic bag.
Students will place the packet in a tote that will be on the bus steps. They will then be handed their third instructional packet. The material in the second packet will be brought to the school for review by each student’s teacher.
If you would prefer, starting on Friday, April 27th you can drop off the second packet and pick up the third packet at the school from 8:00am – 12:00pm. Come to the main office to do so.
If you are a student who walks to school, you can come to get your packet starting on Friday, April 24th from 8:00am - 12:00pm.
Also, for students living in the Valley Stream Trailer park, a bus will be at the front of the park at 1:00pm on Thursday for the exchange of packets.
In closing, I know this is a lot of information and a lot of change. Our country has been through a lot in this and the last century, but nothing quite like this. I am confident we will make it through this pandemic and be all the stronger for it.
Take Care, Stay Well.
Mrs. Wenck

br.span: The registration is postponed until further notice and anyone registering a child for kindergarten next year needs to contact the main office at the school (432-2050) to provide the following information: name of child and parents, address, phone numbers, age of child. Thank you!

br.div:
Due to the on-going impact the COVID 19 situation is having on NYS finances, the information provided to schools on state aid is constantly changing. As a result, the annual Community Budget Meeting, originally scheduled for April 15th, 2020, has been postponed at this time. It is our hope to reschedule the meeting in the future. Please continue to visit our website for updates
Read More...

br.a: ADDITIONAL INFORMATION REGARDING THE SCHOOL CLOSURE

br.span: Notice to all Residents: Due to the change in the State-wide school voting day, as mandated by the Governor of the State of New York, please disregard the publication of the Laurens Central School District Legal Public Notice, dated March 27, 2020.
